intro: Pseuduvaria bruneiensis, commonly known as the Brunei pseuduvaria, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the rainforests of Brunei. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that mature to a reddish hue, attracting various wildlife species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
